articles.title: Assignments
articles.contents:
As you go, you may develop your own R Markdown style you like or you might use my file layout to start. If you’d like a different starting point, you can use the template below.


 Download template.Rmd file


Fall 2021 Assignments
Assignment #1
Goals:
Set up and use git and GitHub with RStudio.
Create a personal website and hear about why this is a useful thing to have.
Start generating ideas about your project for the course.
Read about and reflect on bias and fairness in data science.


 Download Assignment #1!


Assignment #2
Goals:
Continue using and become more comfortable with Git and GitHub.
Refresh your machine learning skills.
Use the tidymodels packages to build models.
Read about and reflect on bias and fairness in data science.


 Download Assignment #2!


Assignment #3
Goals:
Continue using and become more comfortable with Git and GitHub.
Build more machine learning models using tidymodels, including xgboost.
Build and use a stacked model.
Start thinking about a shiny app.
Explore new packages from “Function Friday”.
Continue learning about bias and fairness in data science.


 Download Assignment #3!


Assignment #4
Goals:
Continue using and become more comfortable with Git and GitHub.
Use SQL inside of R.
Make some amazing graphs!
Create a shiny app using the slightly more advanced Shiny tips we covered in class.
Explore new packages from “Function Friday”.


 Download Assignment #4!


Spring 2021 Assignments
Assignment #1
Goals:
Set up and use git and GitHub with RStudio.
Create a personal website and be motivated to do it.
Create a small package (optional).
Refresh your machine learning skills.
Use the tidymodels packages to build models.
Read about and reflect on bias and fairness in data science.


 Download Assignment #1!


Assignment #2
Goals:
Continue using and become more comfortable with Git and GitHub.
Build more machine learning models using tidymodels.
Build and use a stacked model.
Use some global model interpretation tools.
Create a shiny app that allows you to interact with a model.
Add some customized theming to a shiny app.
Continue learning about bias and fairness in data science.


 Download Assignment #2!


Assignment #3
Goals:
Continue using and become more comfortable with Git and GitHub.
Use some local model interpretation tools.
Use SQL inside of R.
Make some amazing graphs!
Practice using geom_sf()
Practice using tidytext
Continue learning about bias and fairness in data science.


 Download Assignment #3!


Assignment #4
Goals:
Practice using tmap
Practice using regular expressions via stringr
Continue learning about bias and fairness in data science.


 Download Assignment #4!


Assignment #5
Practice using countrycode R package.


 Download Assignment #5!

articles.title: Welcome!
articles.contents:
Welcome to the Advanced Data Science in R course being taught by me, Lisa Lendway. The calendar for the course can be found on the course Moodle page, which is where you will also submit assignments. Materials for each topic we cover can be found on the Course Materials page of this website. I also included a page with some of the resources I will use (and more!) and a page with the assignments.
Syllabus - Fall 2021
OLD Syllabus - Sring 2021

articles.title: Resources
articles.contents:
Review material
Lisa’s Intro DS course
Prof. Brianna Heggeseth’s Machine Learning course - she’ll be building the site throughough the fall 2021 semester and is using tidymodels
Hands on Machine Learning with R by Bradley Boehmke and Brandon Greenwell
Johns Hopkins SPH ADS course site by Jeff Leek and Roger Peng (Has both review and new material)
Getting help/advise
Create a reprex! (reproducible example)
Build a Career in Data Science podcast by Jacqueline Nolis and Emily Robinson
git/GitHub in R
Lisa’s GitHub for collaboration
Lisa’s more in-depth post and video that goes more in-depth on how to collaborate
Happy git with R by Jenny Bryan
R Packages - making a PR from the R Packages boook by Hadley Wickham and Jenny Bryan
Pull request helpers from the usethis package
Building a website
Sharing on Short Notice with Alison Hill and Desirée De Leon from R Studio
Lisa’s Building a distill website blog post
Tom Mock’s distill post
The Distillery showcase featuring websites made with distill and their source code.
Emily Zabor’s tutorial
blogdown book site by Yihui Xie, Amber Thomas, and Alison Hill and check out recent updates here
Building an R package
Lisa’s example of building a data package
Your first R package in 1 hour blog post by Shannon Pileggi
Tom Westlake’s Writing an R Package From Scratch
R Packages book by Wickham and Bryan
Custom ggplot2 themes
theme() documentation (if you’re like me, you might as well keep this tab open at all times on your computer)
Joey Stanley’s blog post
Maddie Pickens’ tutorial
Shiny
Lisa’s intro to building a shiny app
Lisa’s Shiny tips for a “bit more than the basics” in Shiny
R Studio tutorials by Garret Grolemund
a gRadual intRoduction to Shiny by Ted Laderas
Intro to Shiny by Katherine Hébert, Andrew MacDonald, Jake Lawlor, and Vincent Bellevance
Mastering Shiny by Hadley Wickham
Theming Shiny and R markdown with {thematic} and {bslib} with Carson Sievert from R Studio (formerly, I had a similar but older talk posted)
Using CSS to style your shiny app by Sharla Gelfand
Tidymodels
tidymodels.org main page
Tidy Models with R textbook by Julia Silge and Max Kuhn
Lisa’s tidymodels noRth presentation
Julia Silge’s blog with great examples
Model stacking / ensembles
stacks R package documentation by Simon Couch and Max Kuhn and Simon’s lightnight talk.
Hands on Machine Learning by Bradley Boehmke & Brandon Greenwell
Interpretable Machine Learning
DALExtra R package by Szymon Maksymiuk, Przemyslaw Biecek
lime R package tutorial by Bradley Boemke
Interpretable Machine Learning by Christoph Molnar
Explanatory Model Analysis by Przemyslaw Biecek and Tomasz Burzykowski
Hands on Machine Learning
Data ethics / justice
fast.ai ethics course by Rachel Thomas
Data Justice intro by Linnet Taylor
Prediction-Based Decisions and Fairness by Shira Mitchell, Eric Potash, Solon Barocas, Alexander D’Amour, Kristian Lum
teachdatascience blog
Data Science Ethics chapter of Modern Data Science with R by Baumer, Kaplan, and Horton
Calling Bullshit course materials by Bergstrom and West.
Using databases with R / SQL
Vebash Naidoo’s blog posts
Dr. Simona Picardi’s course material from WILD 6900: Tools for Reproducible Science, Spring 2021, Utah State University
SQL chapter of Modern Data Science with R by Baumer, Kaplan, and Horton
Jacqueline Nolis blog post: Pretending to have a SQL database with RStudio
Databases using R from RStudio
Putting R into production
Put R in prod
Simple model example on Ray Buhr’s blog
Simple plumber example on R Studio’s site (thanks for the link, Thomas Mock)
Gradient boosted machines (GBM) and H20
Hands on Machine Learning
xgboost R package documentation
xgboost with tidymodels example by Julia Silge.
H20 documentation
H20 booklet
Deep Learning
Deep Learning with R
Hands on Machine Learning
Neural Networks YouTube video series by 3Blue1Brown
Neural Networks and Deep Learning by Michael Nielsen
TensorFlow for R tutorials
